availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Franklin D. Wyatt (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth C. Rice in Logan County, Kentucky, on November 7, 1846. Father of Alice Wyatt, Mary J. Wyatt, John Leeper Wyatt, Franklin Henry Wyatt, Louisa Wyatt, Lilly Wyatt, and Robert Wyatt. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Employed Thomas Young as an overseer in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 313B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 832.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p.212A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 441A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Logan County Marriages, Film 000851644.
